byline.contributor: Anne Lawrence Guyon contributed reporting from Brattleboro, Vt. Alain Delaquérière contributed research from New York.

abstract: United States Attorney's office, which is re-investigating unsolved 1990 theft of $500 million worth of art from Boston’s Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, draws fresh attention to videotape recorded 24 hours before heist; tape shows security guard Richard Abath buzzing unidentified man into museum under circumstances similar to robbery, causing speculation about Abath’s culpability and raising possibility that video remained unwatched until recently.
lead_paragraph: Security footage from the night before the largest art heist in American history draws fresh attention to a rookie security guard.

headline.main: 25 Years After Gardner Museum Heist, Video Raises Questions
headline.print_headline: After 25 Years, Video May Illuminate Art Heist

snippet: Security footage from the night before the largest art heist in American history draws fresh attention to a rookie security guard.
